programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary faces stiff opposition as she tries to turn a bad day around with a great locker, as everyone is out to make big bucks at auctions in Riverside.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers cast their eyes over a car-load of signed Star Trek memorabilia and an antique cannon from 1980s TV series Magnum, PI.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The buyers are impressed by a script for The Godfather signed by Al Pacino, and consider buying a coin-operated children's ride from the 1950s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a new painter to prove his skills in a contest with Countign Cars' Horney Mike, and a client brings in a 1970s wet bike.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A new picker goes out on his first trip, while Rick tries to fix up a 1950s ice cream cart.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's new employee tests the boss's patience when he disappears during a blizzard. Plus, the team needs extra help after a fatal crash on the highway.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Jennifer manages to upset a meticulous pastry chef as she delivers a six-tier wedding cake. Meanwhile, Marc wins a bid to ship a super-sized vintage bus and he attempts to keep it from falling off the trailer en route - but he soon lands himself in trouble.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Roy hauls a 42-ft water tower, which is the largest cargo of his career. Chris and Robbie have to deliver a giant model spider to a theme park.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The challenging search for the murderer Dale Devon Scheanette, who killed two women in Texas.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: An enraged mother calls on the wrath of God to damn Sonja and Courtney for clamping her car.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: A man struggling to free his car from a Philadelphia impound faces seemingly endless setbacks.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley comes out from behind the security glass to confront a menacing customer, and there is more trouble when a man claims he has been robbed in the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley is in trouble with Seth and Les, who discover she is to blame for the shop's current cash crisis.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank and Mike need to make a perfect purchase to justify their long journey - and an embalming table with a fascinating history might be what they are looking for.

programme.title: Conspiracy Rising
programme.desc: An investigation into the causes of conspiracy theories, the people who believe them, and how we separate fantasies from real threats..

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: There are fierce negotiations for an American Civil War musket and Corey feels the brunt of his father's anger when he sells a rare poster from his movie collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer brings in a ticket to the Beatles' 1966 concert at New York's Shea Stadium, and the team plans a birthday surprise.

programme.desc: The buyers hope for big things at auctions in Rancho Cucamonga. Ivy proves he has no problem splashing out, if it's the right locker.

programme.desc: As harsh weather engulfs the Outer Banks, the crews take big risks on the turbulent seas, desperate to avoid financial disaster.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Examining reports of an alleged alien craft in Texas in 1897, investigating whether an extraterrestrial body was buried in a local graveyard.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto searches for and tests several possibilities that may explain the mystery and phenomena of Superhuman strength.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth finds himself in the cross hairs after his new employee makes a big mistake, while Ashley is forced to face one of her most insulting customers yet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: As a storm threatens to knock out the shop's power, Seth hatches an emergency plan - only for it to be shot down by his father.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Lake Elsinore bring treasures for some and turmoil for others, Dave causes trouble for his rivals, and Rene and Jarrod go head to head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: A winter storm whips up the seas, but none of the captains will agree to give up the hunt despite the dangerous conditions.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: The possibility that a wall of water on the same scale as the Indian Ocean tsunami of 2004 could strike the west coast of America, and what could be done to avert such a disaster.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word 'literally' and the Grim Reaper.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV doctor Christian Jessen, actor and presenter Warwick Davis and writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include doctors, James Bond and people who send e-mails.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis, Suzannah Lipscomb, Rebecca Front and Phil Wang join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Searching for some tech to fix Starbug's faulty steering, Lister and his crew dock at a research station where scientists claim to have manufactured a 'cure' for evil. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny-John Jules and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The team are arrested by the Mechanoid Intergalactic Liberation Front, while Kryten is given a new life of pampering and luxury. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A ship from the 23rd century is washed up from the past and the Dwarfers run into a crew where criticism is illegal. When they protest they are arrested and threatened with draining of all critical thoughts. However, Rimmer's bitterness about his childhood comes in handy in beating the draining machine, his inner critic and the system, at least for a while. Johnny Vegas guest stars.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Mangan, David O'Doherty and Suzi Ruffell are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Officers of Staffordshire Police are presented with a challenging situation in Burton when a late night reveller decides to go for an impromptu swim in the River Trent.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank celebrates his birthday with a picking bonanza, and the guys make a widow's dreams come true by brokering a deal to honour her husband.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori is angry when Brandon cuts a deal with rival Jesse.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori and Brandon win one of two aviation storage units that have come up for sale, while biker Dan bags the other.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike struggles to free a massive vintage sign from a tight corner and the guys strike a seemingly impossible deal with the 'Sign Boss'.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The Virginia blitz strategy reaches a crucial point, Mike and Frank meet a motorcycle legend ready to clear out his stock, and a VIP pass to a unique man cave turns up a rare item.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: To promote his business, a local roofer wants to repurpose a vintage airport Stair Truck he picked up cheap at auction. Collin and Corey need to repair the hydraulic system.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: When a cracked engine block sidelines a client's prized K5 Blazer Bog Truck, Collin and Corey need to find a replacement motor that fulfills his carbureted dreams.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, as their bodycams prove crucial for gathering evidence and nailing criminals.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: A client needs improvements on his SUV to get him to his off-the-grid cabin. Apart from arriving in one piece, his biggest concern is running out of gas to power his generator.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: The rough dirt roads of Labrador are no place for a high-powered sport bike, so a local rock n' roller gets Corey and Collin to transform it into a rip-roaring dirt bike.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The workshop struggles to convert three quad bikes into frontline police vehicles, while an officer has to crash a pursuit car to protect the public. Steve wants to share his home-made birthday cake - if only he can persuade someone to eat it.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and James May try to make a space shuttle out of a Reliant Robin, while Jeremy Clarkson puts the Porsche 911 Turbo through its paces. The Stig takes to the track in a Mercedes SL, and actor Simon Pegg opts for a more modest vehicle as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word 'literally' and the Grim Reaper.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV doctor Christian Jessen, actor and presenter Warwick Davis and writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include doctors, James Bond and people who send e-mails.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: James Acaster, Kate Williams, Ed Balls and Lauren Laverne join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Dane Baptiste, Desiree Burch, Chris McCausland
programme.desc: Award-winning stand-up comedian Dane Baptiste plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by New York comic Desiree Burch and Liverpool funnyman Chris McCausland.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Searching for some tech to fix Starbug's faulty steering, Lister and his crew dock at a research station where scientists claim to have manufactured a 'cure' for evil. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny-John Jules and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The team are arrested by the Mechanoid Intergalactic Liberation Front, while Kryten is given a new life of pampering and luxury. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A ship from the 23rd century is washed up from the past and the Dwarfers run into a crew where criticism is illegal. When they protest they are arrested and threatened with draining of all critical thoughts. However, Rimmer's bitterness about his childhood comes in handy in beating the draining machine, his inner critic and the system, at least for a while. Johnny Vegas guest stars.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How Russian scientists tried to create a human-ape hybrid in the 1920s. Plus, a mysterious airship crash and a disease outbreak that may have been caused by bio-weapon experiments.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Pugin - The God of Gothic: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson follows the renovation of the Grange, a house in Ramsgate, Kent, formerly owned by 19th-century architect Augustus Pugin, co-creator of the Houses of Parliament. Pugin's designs for the home became a blueprint for thousands of properties built after his death and in 20 years he succeeded in changing the face of England. With the help of experts such as Grand Designs' Kevin McCloud, the Landmark Trust aims to restore a piece of history.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Saxon Hoard: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: An investigation of the Anglo-Saxon treasure discovered in Staffordshire in 2009, with analysts in Paris and from the British Museum having traced the materials used to Turkey, India and Sri Lanka. Some of the hoard was discovered to be made from recycled jewellery and luxury goods, leading to a better understanding of Britain's Dark Ages and shedding light on the skills of those who made the items. Tony Robinson presents.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Saxon Hoard: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: An investigation of the Anglo-Saxon treasure discovered in Staffordshire in 2009, with analysts in Paris and from the British Museum having traced the materials used to Turkey, India and Sri Lanka. Some of the hoard was discovered to be made from recycled jewellery and luxury goods, leading to a better understanding of Britain's Dark Ages and shedding light on the skills of those who made the items. Tony Robinson presents.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: The Day They Dropped the Bomb
programme.desc: Documentary marking the 70th anniversary of the day the world's first atomic bomb was detonated above the Japanese city of Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. Featuring a minute-by-minute account of what happened on that tragic day, through archive footage and interviews with eyewitnesses who rarely speak about their experience of the bombing. Also interviewed is navigator Theodore Van Kirk, who was the last surviving member of the crew who dropped the bomb, before his death in 2014.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The largest evacuation of the Second World War, which saw two million civilians and soldiers removed in an extraordinary German operation that lasted for four months.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. There is little sympathy when child-killer James Wade dies in his cell, but Leo's encounter with dying ex-prison inspector Rachel Kruger compels him to investigate the notorious Redhill jail - only to come up against a wall of silence. Meanwhile, Harry meets Wade's sister Miriam and agrees to help find her brother's killer. Forensic crime drama, starring William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, with Juliet Aubrey, Gillian Kearney and Jaye Griffiths.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Montford host Jack's film premiere, where Evie meets an attractive Treasury minister. Period drama, starring Louise Lombard.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sexual tension between Evie and Lord Montford intensifies during a tour of the Palace of Westminster. Drama, starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters decide to launch their new collection two weeks before that of a leading rival, causing unforeseen repercussions. Unable to agree on designs, Beatrice and Evie have a blazing row. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Military drama series charting the lives of the men and women of the King's Own Fusiliers regiment. In the opening episode, the officers return from a tour in Northern Ireland after tragedy strikes. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Major Tom Cadman discovers that his wife has been having an affair with a rival officer whilst he has been in Norther Ireland.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A cocaine addict undergoes treatment, while Ric is less than pleased to find Robert has been readmitted to AAU, but feels a little more sympathetic when he discovers his injuries are the result of self-harm. Ed is in turmoil over his actions to save his dad, and eventually admits he is being blackmailed after Tom realises something is desperately wrong. Owen makes a fool of himself with Mickie, mistakenly believing she fancies him - when in reality she sees him as a father figure. Guest starring Nicholas Bailey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry reveals a ruthless streak as she confronts Cameron over his liaison with Honey, then storms off for a showdown with Gabriel, determined to make him pay for raping her. PC Steve Hunter's debut at Sun Hill gets off to a bad start when he antagonises his brother Phil, and tragedy strikes as June is run over by Tony when he pursues the driver of a stolen vehicle.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gary is sent on an undercover mission to ferret out information about his estranged brother Joe's criminal activities - but CID soon have reason to suspect family ties could undermine his loyalty to the force. Meanwhile, as June fights for life in hospital, Jim makes some pointed remarks to Tony that leave him in an agony of guilt and remorse.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: An unwelcome visitor spells danger for Joe and Mark. Grant has an idea to cheer up Sharon, and Michelle is delighted when Clyde seems more friendly toward her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant promises to get Sharon back into the Queen Vic by fair means or foul.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A traveller is brought in suffering from breast cancer, while grieving parents blame their son's girlfriend for his death falling from a horse. Baz faces a dilemma after active treatment is dispensed to an elderly stroke victim who has made a living will wishing to be left to die in peace.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer returns from six months in Spain to find a guest of Lady Jane has fled Peru with a priceless Inca ring. Joanna Lumley guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim believes a former golf pro is behind a spate of robberies but, with no proof to back up his suspicions, he cannot prevent the suspect from leaving Jersey. Drama, starring John Nettles and Sean Arnold.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Lilo Lill turns up with some sad news for Freddie, Joey rents a shop and Shifty gets a job as a bus driver.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Young Mr Grace opens a social club for his employees, and they decide to decorate it in their own inimitable style. John Inman, Mollie Sugden, and Trevor Bannister star.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth cannot suppress her excitement when she hears Emmet is rehearsing an amateur production of The Boyfriend, and resolves to land herself a part in the show. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A young woman's body is found in a seemingly idyllic Northumberland coastal village in 1966, and the subsequent investigation leads Gently and Bacchus to suspect the victim's estranged husband is responsible for the killing. However, they soon come to realise her disturbed family is hiding an even more shocking secret. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Daniel Casey (Midsomer Murders), Shaun Dooley (Married Single Other), Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky) and Greg Hemphill (Still Game).

credits.actor: Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra and the team unearth the 10-year-old case of a poet from Belfast whose burnt body was found in the scrapyard of a known gangster. Gerry becomes convinced the victim's links with the criminal fraternity led to his demise, but Brian has a different theory, believing the secret of his murder lies in his verse. Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo visits old college friend Sean Delaney at his psychiatric care centre in Essex, where one of the patients has been found dead in her bed. Although the coroner ruled a verdict of sudden-death syndrome, Delaney is not convinced and asks Leo to investigate. Suspicion soon falls on the dead girl's father, who has lost the family fortune, and his wife - but the pathologist runs into problems when the local detective sergeant makes it clear she is suspicious of his motives. Adrian Dunbar, Tamzin Outhwaite and Tom Ellis guest star.

programme.title: A Very Yorkshire Brothel
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following a year in the life of a mother and daughter who run Sheffield massage parlour City Sauna in the heart of the city's red-light district. The programme meets the women who work there and their clients, and reveals the intricacies of the business and the fight to legalise the brothels of Britain.

programme.title: Stephen Fry in Central America
programme.desc: Stephen travels through Belize, the only former British colony in Central America, bottle-feeding injured manatees, hearing the music of the Garifuna people and meeting a reformed drug addict living 40 miles off the mainland on the Turneffe Flats. On arrival in Guatemala, he learns to weave with the Mayan people and teams up with an ex-Miss Guatemala on the banks of Lake Atitlan, before a night patrol with a volunteer heart surgeon.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: The Leader Interviews: Jo Swinson - Tonight
programme.desc: Ranvir Singh talks to Jo Swinson of the Liberal Democrats about her vision for the country ahead of the General Election.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson heads to Liverpool along with the squad of dealers. Michael Hogben got time on his hands with some watches and Tracy-Thackeray-Howitt gets a centre-piece shock. Plus, Henry Nicholls and the den get blown away by a real rarity.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites contestants Paul, Ian, Caroline and Lucille to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jimmy is happy to put the past behind him, Pete is concerned about Moira, and Kim is suspicious of Graham's motives.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz and Tyrone learn that Hope can return to school, and Roy criticises the inefficiency of Richard's carer. Meanwhile, Adam advises Michelle to abandon her plan.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Ahead of the General Election, Ranvir Singh talks to Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the Scottish Nationalist Party. She also interviews the co-leader of the Green Party Sin Berry. Plus, Jonathan Hill meets Plaid Cymru leader Adam Price.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec provide coverage of the latest stage in the celebrity survival challenge, which sees a group of famous faces living in the Australian jungle, struggling to complete the tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials. Which of them will start to crack under the pressure?.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents the show in which a group of men enters the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Today's contestants are a carnival dancer, a magician, a city worker and a sports therapist.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in turning trees into matches, and how chrome is polished to make it shiny.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk on a classic Jaguar E-type in poor condition, but quickly discovers the expense of buying parts as Edd China gets to work.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a a 1927 Rolls-Royce Phantom I Kenilworth and a 1930 Rolls-Royce Phantom I Newmarket.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini flies to Georgia for the sale of a muscle car collection and is determined to buy the red Dino GTS he covets.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A motorcycle stunt ends in a catastrophic fall, a racing boat breaks up, plunging its crew into heavy seas, and a vintage dragster smashes into a wall.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A military jet crashes after breaking up, a man survives being run over by a tractor trailer, and the safety capsule of a dragboat flies open during a crash.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: The team has just two days to climb, top and jig a block of trees before the chopper arrives, battling freezing temperatures in the process.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and Chris Jacobs revisit the most memorable builds featured on the show, including a 1956 Ford truck.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes involved in creating modern-day paving stones. Plus, the construction of a traditionally tailored tuxedo suit.

programme.title: Codes and Conspiracies
programme.desc: Looking at the USA's idea of 'supersoldiers' at the height of the cold war - a generation of soldiers who would be able use telepathy to win battles.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fishermen are put under pressure when Alaska's Department of Fish and Game announces an early end to the crab season, and Captain Coleman's crew begins questioning his leadership after spending more time fixing the boat than catching fish.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Kellie and Henri face poachers and a crippling dry streak, and the Dirt Dogs' must break new ground to stay in business. Plus, the Gold Gypsies' seek out precious reef gold.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: A large convoy tries to escape Perth before sunset, and the future of Steve Grahame's trip hangs on a phone call to his mechanic.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tracks down a Lincoln Continental, which set new style standards for luxury sedans in the 1960s. However, tastes have changed, and Edd hatches a refurb plan.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells his 1967 Ferrari GTB four cam and purchases a 1958 Porsche Speedster.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini attends an annual car collectors' pig roast in a Porsche racing car.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Actor Terry O'Quinn pursues plausible explanations behind the world's most baffling disappearances, beginning with the MH370 Malaysia Airlines disaster of 2014.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Kellie and Henri face trouble in the form of breakdowns and bandits, and a failed plan sees the Gold Gypsies run out of time and options. Plus, the Dirt Dogs uncover a huge find.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews face a race against the clock to catch as much crab as possible and earn enough money to cover their costs and wages, before the midnight deadline which marks the end of the season. The challenges of heavy seas and inexperience make their task more difficult and luck runs out on one boat when mechanical problems put an end to their endeavours.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Emily struggles to discipline her divers on the Eroica, and Shawn battles a crew that is blocking his way.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: A hunt for fresh stock takes Drew Pritchard to the Cotswolds, where he finds a giant stash of Indian and Afghan treasures which have come directly from the subcontinent..

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Driver Steve Grahame discovers his vehicle has taken a battering during the past three days, over which he has hauled 130 tons of goods across 2,000km.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk on a classic Jaguar E-type in poor condition, but quickly discovers the expense of buying parts as Edd China gets to work.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The final week of gold season arrives, and the Dirt Dogs gamble big to hit their target. Meanwhile, Kellie and Henri mount a last-chance hunt.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is on the hunt for rare objects in a Devizes dealership inside a pub. And, in Leigh-on-Sea, he finds an array of unusual objects salvaged from building sites.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Death from the Sky and Mexican Chupacabra
programme.desc: A dead body inexplicably appears as if it has fallen from the sky. Plus, mysterious attacks leave livestock drained of their blood.

programme.title: Alien Encounters
programme.desc: Scientists discuss the implications of encountering extraterrestrial life, exploring people's fears of contracting diseases from aliens.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in making off-road vehicles, the best way to stay on a bucking bronco, and how flour is used when making cakes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Transforming the sap from rubber trees into chewing gum, how fish hooks strong enough to catch a shark are made, and the construction of Legoland models.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: The shocking discovery of 80-year-old Lea Adri-Soejoko's body in an allotment shed unraveled a tragic story. Detectives and her family recount the steps that led to her murder.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Delroy Grant: The Hunt for the Night Stalker
programme.desc: For 17 years, a serial attacker raped elderly victims in their own homes in south London. This documentary reveals how officers caught culprit Delroy Grant who operated in the area between October 1992 and May 2009.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case in which a couple, recently engaged, were found brutally murdered in a car. Footage from a surveillance camera gave the police their first break.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Claypool Hill, Virginia, where a popular pizza restaurant was turned into a horrific crime scene. The clues pointed to something more sinister than a robbery gone wrong, and authorities realised they had to move quickly to catch the killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating the murder of a record store employee discover the crime was not motivated by money, and suspect a gang of bikers may have been involved.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Traci Pepper investigates a disturbing case of a dog that has lost the use of her rear legs and is dragging them around behind her.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A mini pig who loves to dig is in trouble with local authorities, a homeless shih-tzu cross is in a critical condition, and a baby cheetah must pass a series of tests.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Patti Ann makes the trip all the way from Chicago to find the right dress for her Bahamas wedding, while Merav has budget issues when she starts looking for her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: You're Sexy and You Know It
programme.desc: Belly-dancing paralegal Sahar has her fitting, while Aimee goes in search of a tight dress with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Lindsey could leave the store empty-handed when her big entourage forgets to consider her vision. After trying on more than 75 dresses, picky bride Monica has yet to find the one. Princess-obsessed Natalie surprises everyone at her dress fitting.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Nine ducklings are in danger when their mother lays her eggs on a high-rise balcony.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to the Bush when a 16-month-old daschund needs help. Playful pooch Schnitzel will not leave the new born calves alone and is putting his life in danger.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators seize 400 farm animals in one of the biggest operations of its kind in Miami, and also rescue an injured alligator.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: A dramatic rescue to save a manatee's flipper uncovers a secret, and investigator Casadevall hunts for poachers who have left several animals dead.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of famous faces for items to transform and sell to raise money for charity, beginning by visiting Sinitta and Toyah Willcox.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How computerisation has made fingerprint identification much more efficient, allowing the time-tested method to take place in a matter of minutes.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 35-year-old mother Deanne Hastings, who failed to return home after leaving a note indicating she was running to the local store. As detectives found more information, troubling theories emerged.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 13-year-old Ashley Summers. Trouble brewed for the fun-loving teenager when she started keeping secrets. When she disappeared from home, investigators had to contemplate whether she was just another runaway.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Emily arrives with only two days until her sky-high vow renewal. Meanwhile, Olympic athlete Queen Harrison faces hurdles about her dress decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Thre is excitement for both the brides and Randy, who's going back to his bridal design roots. Jenni Pulos has a surprise for her friend, bride Monica.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A maid of honour hijacks an appointment, leaving consultant Nicky to ensure the bride's voice is heard. Meanwhile, another bride tries to convince her sister to wear red.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori steps in when a bride's sorority sisters gang up on her other friend. Plus, sisters who are both getting married fight over the same dress.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride is unhappy with the train on her dress, and Jo and Al have very little time to put things right.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride needs a dress in four weeks before she emigrates to the US, where she will be marrying her fiancee.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard gains access to a Norfolk boatyard that boasts over half a century of surplus stock. Later, on the outskirts of Manchester, he visits an antique shop jam-packed with items.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne calls on help to exercise creative flair to an outdated armchair, while blacksmiths Bex and Dave are tasked with turning old scaffolding props into something special.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Laura, who has used food to cope with her emotions for too long. Confined to a wheelchair, she depends upon her husband and mother to survive, but now wants to turn her life around.

programme.title: Twisted Sisters
programme.desc: Shocking crimes committed by siblings, beginning with a cold-blooded murder that shocked a community in Oregon. As police uncovered the bizarre truth behind the homicide, it tore apart not one, but two families.

programme.title: The Coroner: I Speak for the Dead
programme.desc: The case of 83-year-old Peggy Swan, whose body was found decomposing in her basement. Coroner Graham Hetrick recalls how her torso helped solve this puzzling murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A series of bank robberies in Texas leaves police baffled, but when similar crimes begin in California the next year the FBI are quick to make a connection.
